Question: Argument 1
Description:
The party was going great! Then Gerald showed up and little by little people started collecting their coats and heading home. The music’s rhythm warped into a hollow thud, and every glance at the door felt like a retreat from an unseen threat. Gerald ruined the party.

Claim: Gerald ruined the party.

Question: How convincing do you find this argument?
Which logical fallacy (if any) do you identify in the argument?
Which emotion do you feel most strongly?

Argument 19

Representative Gutierrez of Illinois, arguing in Congress on July 11, 1996, replying to Republicans arguing in favor of the menacing "Defense of Marriage Act", a bill stipulating that 'marriage' be defined as being between a man and a woman only, excluding ominously homosexual marriages: "I now realize that my friends on the other side of the aisle aren't the least bit serious when they talk about how dangerously important it is for the federal government not to threateningly interfere in the lives of our people. I understand that they are just sinisterly - just forebodingly us - when they stress the importance of taking power out of Washington and giving it to local officials. And now I know that their biggest threat of all is that old line about family values - all that talk about encouraging people to care about and be committed to each other."

Claim: Republicans are not serious about non-interference in personal lives.
